Use an optional '$' to visually mark the end of
a line; and also prevent auto whitespace trimmers.
-- input --
Col1,Col2,Col3
1,longish,a
2,short,bb
3.0,foo,ccc
-- defaults --
-- want --
Col1, Col2,    Col3$
   1, longish, a   $
   2, short,   bb  $
 3.0, foo,     ccc $
-- as markdown --
-md
-- want --
| Col1 | Col2    | Col3 |
| ---: | ------- | ---- |
|    1 | longish | a    |
|    2 | short   | bb   |
|  3.0 | foo     | ccc  |
-- max_width --
-maxw=6
-- want --
Col1, Col2,   Col3$
   1, lon..., a   $
   2, short,  bb  $
 3.0, foo,    ccc $
-- max_width_markdown --
-maxw=6 -md
-- want --
| Col1 | Col2   | Col3 |
| ---: | ------ | ---- |
|    1 | lon... | a    |
|    2 | short  | bb   |
|  3.0 | foo    | ccc  |
-- input --
Col1
®©℗™℠℃℉№
-- max_width_non_ascii --
-maxw=6
-- want --
Col1  $
®©℗...$
-- input --
Col1,Col2,Col3
1,longish,a
2,"line1
line2",bb
3.0,foo,ccc
-- multiline default --
-- want --
Col1, Col2,     Col3$
   1, longish,  a   $
   2, line1..., bb  $
 3.0, foo,      ccc $
-- multiline markdown --
-md
-- want --
| Col1 | Col2     | Col3 |
| ---: | -------- | ---- |
|    1 | longish  | a    |
|    2 | line1... | bb   |
|  3.0 | foo      | ccc  |

-box

+------+---------+------+
| Col1 | Col2    | Col3 |

|    1 | longish | a    |

|    2 | line1   | bb   |
|      | line2   |      |

|  3.0 | foo     | ccc  |
